Reviews.Title: “Nice budget hotel near Termini”
Reviews.Author: mwehle
Reviews.Content: Hotel Romae is a few blocks away from Rome's central station, in a safe, clean neighborhood, in a block with hotels and restaurants which during April 2012 catered to many American college students. I stayed here at the beginning and end of my trip, providing the chance to sample two different rooms. The first room was on the third floor and faced the street. This was out of range of the hotel's free WiFi, and posed the choice of either stuffiness, with the windows closed, or sleeplessness, as across the street below drunken young people talked noisily at all hours. The room's climate control functioned only to turn an internal fan on or off. My second room, also on the third floor, had good WiFi, and while facing an interior courtyard made for less of a view it also meant I could sleep with the windows open. The hotel staff were unfailingly polite and the hotel was clean. Hotel Romae has no restaurant, but provides tokens for free drinks at the restaurant across the street, which during breakfasts seems packed with American college students crouched over their smartphones and iPads.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay...recommend to all”
Reviews.Author: Red80_12
Reviews.Content: I stayed in November with a friend and would recommend to anyone wanting a very clean convenient place to stay in Rome. Its out of the hustle and bustle off the main street and provides a safe and secure place to stay. I became unwell while staying and required a doctor, the staff were extremely helpful and kind. When I return to Rome I will be rebooking this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Simply average, you get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: guayaca06
Reviews.Content: Me and my mother stayed in this hotel for about 4 days while we visited Rome. It is well located as it is at a walking distance from the Termini Station (maybe 2-3 blocks away). When you first walk into the hotel it is a building shared with other hotels and businesses. The elevator is very small (one of those that you can see its structure and ropes) and it only fits about 2 people (that's without bags), so if you have a big party it's best to take the stairs. They do have a small communal area fit with a computer and internet access (which is very helpful in case you don't have a computer), as well complementary coffee, tea and orange juice. The room was small but well fitted, it had two twin beds, small comfortable bathroom, tv and cable. The main problem we had with the room was the smell. It seemed to be coming from the bathroom, and it was probably a sewage issue since it never went away. We tried to "control" the issues by putting towels on top of the drainage holes. Some of the staff was really nice, like the guy who checked us in, I believe his name was Mark, but the rest of the staff left something to be desired. Most of them had an attitude and seemed almost bothered by our presence. Overall, I was not very impressed with the customer service, with the exception of Mark. Overall it was just an okay experience. It wasn't great, but it wasn't completely horrible. I guess you get what you pay for...

Reviews.Title: “not what i expected”
Reviews.Author: Franca G
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Romae in August of 2008, perfect location, wonderful staff, we were a family of 4 and probably got the smallest room there, i think we were supposed to get something bigger, me and my 2 daughters had to squish on one bed while my husband had to sleep on a pull down bed, very claustrophic in this room, smelled funny also. Our floor was being renovated and we had inhale all that drywall dust, my husband has asthma and was very sick when we left your hotel, he ended up with a pneumonia, when spoke with our travel agent she wasnt even aware that you were renovating or would have never suggested your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price Value”
Reviews.Author: Bioko
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this nice hotel for 5 days. It is located near the Termini station (a few blocks away) and hence not in the historic center of the city. However this is no problem as you have a nearby bus and metro station to get there in minutes. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was nice and clean however they could be a bit more ecological by not exchanging towels everyday (unless we put them on the floor). Two points that we did not like: the mattresses were very worn out with huge dents in the middle (we felt like sleeping on a crater), second the TV is rather on the small side (but has many channels). Good value but there is room for improvements.

Reviews.Title: “Full value for your money”
Reviews.Author: Ygmd
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd time in Rome, and I looked for a nice 3 * hotel near termini, and Romae was perfect! Got a small but clean room on the 4th floor, quiet, tidy, staff was very nice and they even had a coffee/tea corner next to the computer. The only minuses were a wierd smell in the room, and that the cleaning staff did not change the linen or replaced the soap during our entire stay. Other then that it's a real bargin!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel at the right price”
Reviews.Author: Smv123
Reviews.Content: Nice place with friendly staff and an easy walk to Termini. The Yellow Bar associated with the hotel across the street conveniently offers a simple affordable breakfast menu.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service, value and accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Saligator
Reviews.Content: Reasonably price, great location, extremely friendly staff, large and clean rooms, close to the train station, and centrally located to the Center and Forum. Tons of great restaurants and bars nearby. We had a wonderful stay. Great choice when in Rome!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location friendly staffs,tiny room”
Reviews.Author: tzuijenhung
Reviews.Content: Poor internet which I hate the most. Good location

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Eev809
Reviews.Content: Reasonable price, good location, friendly staff, cosy, bright and clean room, nice backyard, waiting room with free tea, coffe and juice, free internet access, free welcome drink in a nearby a youth bar. Enjoyed our stay a lot! A hotel with a special spirit! We would love to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: msozon
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights at Christmas. Great place to stay, just a few minutes walk from the main train station. Clean, comfortable, rooms are small, but it is very reasonably priced. You get a free drink token for the bar across the street upon check in. Friendly helpful service, English spoken. Assorted tea and coffee available whenever (they do shut it down late at night, but will open it up for you if needed). Internet in the lounge, or if you have a cord plug-in in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value. No negatives”
Reviews.Author: MumandSonDublin
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Romae twice. Once with a our family of six and more recently just with our oldest son (23). We knew the location was good but it seemed even more perfect this time. We walked everywhere, including up to Maxxi, Villa Borghese and down to Popolo, Navone, Trevi etc, etc., Once you have the right shoes you can walk everywhere which means you get to see everything and build up a good appetite for all the Italian food. Our room was spotless and spacious and whilst the wireless did not stretch to our room, we used the computer and the wireless in the common area where we also appreciated the free tea and coffee on offer. The hotels breakfast arrangement with the Yellow across the road is a great idea and we had a quick filling breakfast there each morning. The restaurants in the area are a little more expensive than some you can find in town but the food was excellent and very authentic. There is a Conad in Terminii and another just up the road if you want to buy refreshments as the room has a fridge. Proximity to Terminii is also a bonus if taking day trips or connecting with the airport. If we are luck enough to get back to Rome for a third time we'll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: Rain028
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice. The location of the hotel is walking distance (5mins) from Termini Station (Main Station). It's easy go around Rome. There are nice little restaurants around. Their breakfast is quite good. Internet is quite stable. Fresh fruit upon arrival and you can feel free to enjoy coffee or tea in their comfy waiting area. They have friendly Filipino waiting staff at their restaurant. Receptionists are all very nice. My favorite was Anca, she was very informative, smart and offered good help. Would love to come back.

Reviews.Title: “We loved Hotel Romae”
Reviews.Author: Shinerama
Reviews.Content: I've now stayed in Hotel Romae during two trips to Rome. My first time I was the leader of a student group and the second time I brought my family. In both cases, Romae was fantastic. I'd echo what everyone else said-- great rooms, incredibly comfortable beds, distinctive style, wonderful and immensely helpful staff. The family had absolutely NO complaints. And it IS a terrific location--there are nice local restaurants nearby (Mamma Angela is the best on the street, but Pretoriana has nice pizzas and a friendly and attentive staff and Secolo on the corner has good pizza to go) but also pastry shops, the ATM, a grocery store (Sigma), a taxi stand, etc. It's a great base of operations for touring Rome. We love Hotel Romae!

Reviews.Title: “When In Rome... Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: iheartswani
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few nights and had a blast!! We stayed in the Emperor's room... Bed was comfy, room spotless, bathroom was pretty in green. The location was great! Right by the Termini, across the street from The Yellow (the place to hang out after hours not to mention the free drink voucher Hotel Romae provides you). When we were there the restaurant next door offered a special for the guests of Hotel Romae for 10 Euros which included 1 glass of wine, 1st, 2nd & 3rd courses (cant complain eating in europe gets expensive). All in all this place was great!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Well Located Hotel”
Reviews.Author: C L
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a few years ago and still remember this hotel fondly. The reception staff were friendly and speak good English. The hotel is well located, close to transport hubs and not far from major sights in Rome. Convenient to have breakfast at yellow bar (I think) directly opposite. Room was very clean and well maintained. Lift was small but does add much character. Not much of a view from the room but I was out most of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Alice_von_Wonderland
Reviews.Content: Nice personel, they gave us great tips about what to visit in Rome. Free coffee and tea, internet access. Beautiful rooms with an interesting art concept. Very clean as well. The location is also pretty good, close to the Termini station, so it was easy to reach all of the main turistic objectives - which are on a walking distance from the hotel. The are is very safe there, no problem if you're coming back late at night :)

Reviews.Title: “"Well located and clean"”
Reviews.Author: Katherine7535
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, clean and good located Hotel, close to the Termini station, easy to connect with metro to the Coliseum and alle tourist attractions in Rome. I will recommend it for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Cold & Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Tharrow
Reviews.Content: The staff was very nice and the hotel was very clean, however; I was very disappointed, especially after reading so many good reviews. I was so cold I had to sleep in my clothes with a coat and two comforters. When I complained, I was told that the maintenance people do not turn the heat on until November (this was the end of October). The doorway to my room led directly to an outdoor patio, with no other door or insulation. I tried covering the gap with a towel, but it didn't help at all. Also,There is a hostel and a bar directly in front of the hotel, so it was very noisy. I could also hear the traffic noise most of the night. Not a good night for me at all. I wouldn't stay here again. I found a much nicer hotel, closer to the sights for only a few euros more.

Reviews.Title: “a welcoming hotel”
Reviews.Author: clara c
Reviews.Content: Most important feature was the friendly, helpful and welcoming staff. The rooms were very clean and with adequate space and facilities. There is a small lounge that has wi-fi and beverages available. It is well situated, close to most modes of transportation and is convenient walk to most tourist sites. There are restaurants next door that are reasonable with good food if desired. We stayed a couple of nights when we arrived in Rome and decided to come back to this hotel after our tour because of the wonderful experience we and warm welcome we had. The next time we return to Rome, we will definitely return to this hotel and we have recommended it to our friends as well.

Reviews.Title: “A great choice”
Reviews.Author: Bruce C
Reviews.Content: Well situated, close to the Termini rail / Metro station and bus services thus providing excellent links to the airport and main tourist attractions within the city. Our room on the 4th floor, although relatively small, contained everything my wife and I required for our 4 night stay - it was very clean on our arrival and we particularly enjoyed the welcome bowl of fruit provided for us. I have to say that the most memorable element of our stay at the hotel was the superb service provided by the Reception staff who couldn't have been more helpful and attentive to our needs and questions. The free tea / coffee / orange juice provided all day in the small lounge adjacent to Reception, together with daily updates on weather conditions and 'dishes of the day' at the adjacent Mamma Angela's trattoria, added to our enjoyment. We shall have no hesitation in recommending the Hotel Romae to family and friends planning a short-stay visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Romae, very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: The_au_Caramel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well situated, near Termini station which is great when you arrive from the airport with the Leonardo Express, and very convenient to walk to all the main touristic sites. We had the room called Castello, on the 3rd floor (there is a small lift) with a small balcony. It was very clean, quiet, simply and nicely decorated, with a bathroom ensuite. There are lots of nice modern paintings by the same artist in the hotel, representing all the landmarks in a funky way. The staff was friendly and helpful. They speak English and are happy to give advice, book tours etc. There were some free fresh fruits in the room, which was nice. On the first night we did not sleep very well just because the air conditioning was making the air very dry. As the weather was good, we opened the door of the balcony and slept much better the next 2 nights. You can take the breakfast in the Yellow Bar that is just opposite the hotel. Not the best breakfast but cheap and convenient. For better rates at the hotel, it is better to book directly with them.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT STAY”
Reviews.Author: mil18
Reviews.Content: we ve been to the hotel a year ago we had a great stay nice room,very clean,friendly staff at a great location!we had an unforgettable stay!thank u so much!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff, lovely room, great location, highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Tamara G
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Romae for 6 nights in September on a couples trip. It's within easy walking distance of the Termini (main train station and Metro stop) and has many restaurants and pizzerias nearby. It was easy to spot from the corner with a tall sign. The staff was very friendly and welcoming! They stowed our bags for us (securely) as we arrived somewhat earlier than the 1330 check-in and gave us a great map, several brochures and drink coupons for their affiliated bar & restaurant. Amenities are great, free internet (wifi in the lounge and LAN cable in the room), satellite TV, air conditioning, free fresh fruit upon check-in. The bathroom is small-ish with only a shower but the room was very spacious! Only bad note was the pillows, they were terribly uncomfortable, I hated them, but it's my fault for forgetting to bring my own pillow! The bed was medium on the comfort scale but still more than acceptable. Highly recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: ameelmw
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location, close to the main train station (Termini), and is easy to find if you have a map. The room was small, reasonably clean, but otherwise nothing special. The sink and the toilet seat both had a small crack, but that did not affect the function of them. The pillows were not very comfortable and they were unable to give us another. Breakfast was available at a reasonable price at the bar across the street. The restaurant next door (Mamma Angela's), which is affiliated with the hotel, was good and affordable. There was some cleaning and maintenance noise in the hallway in the mornings, and we could hear the person upstairs a little too well. Overall, not a bad hotel, especially considering that we spent most of the day out and about.

Reviews.Title: “Ok enough location, good amenities, reasonable pricing for Rome”
Reviews.Author: marcmerlin
Reviews.Content: Staff was quite helpful. There is no breakfast included, but they have free juice and coffee. We used the fridge to store other food we bought at the almost never closed supermarket under the nearby termini train station. Languages: All spoke perfect or native English. AC: it's a central system, it got the room cooler but we had no control over it, and it still felt too warm for us on some nights. Better than nothing though. Note that you will likely be uncomfortable in a hotel with no AC at all during the summer. bathroom: bathroom was functional and big enough. wifi: You get a wifi code you can use on multiple devices during your stay as well as ethernet in your room. Note that the access point is on the first floor, so the higher you are, the weaker the signal may get. Ask for a low floor room if you care. Breakfast: no breakfast provided. Location: Ok, so it's not really in the center, but it's <10mn walk from the termini train station and 4mn walk from the nearest subway. That was good enough for us. Closer to the center gets more expensive and with fewer ammenities. Elevator: They had a small retrofit elevator in the stairs. It was very small, but enough to save me from carrying my heavy luggage up the stairs. Good enough for me.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Inexpensive Choice in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Christopher S
Reviews.Content: Our family of four (including children, ages 9 and 11) stayed here for 3 nights and found it to be one of the best urban budget hotels. The 5-minute walk from the main train station, which also serves as the primary metro station, allowed easy navigation of the city. There appeared to be numerous reasonable nearby restaurant options (although we did not try any). The room included a spacious king-size bed and a bunk bed, all with new, comfortable sheets and comforters. Very strong air-conditioning (a must-have in August) and very good shower water pressure were much appreciated. Very helpful, English-speaking staff were very accomodating. Only small issue was a slow shower drain. Would undoubtedly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: Liliana F
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there for three nights. The room was excellent. It was spacious, clean and comfortable. We had access to television with channels in english. The computer provided for interente was extremely slow, but the wifi worked fine (access only in th elobby, yhe common room, or across the street at The Yellow). The location, near Termini station, was perfect. We didn't need a taxi at all during our stay. Staff is friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended for families. Clean and spaceious.”
Reviews.Author: Amanda898
Reviews.Content: A great find within walking distance from the central station. The reception is up stairs to the left. The room was safe, clean and spaceous with a comfy bed and sofa beds. A taxi from the airport for fixed E40 is cheaper than a family on the train.

Reviews.Title: “Wow what a friendly hotel!”
Reviews.Author: RatonCantabria
Reviews.Content: This place was just brilliant!! What a find!! We stayed just for one night unfortunately, but it was just great. We arrived early by train, and thought we'd just try to see if we could leave our luggage there. The guy at reception was fantastically friendly and helpful, and told us if we were prepared to wait for 30 minutes we could actually check into the room, great! So we waited in their lovely little patio area, helped ourselves to complementary drinks and used the free internet. The room was simple but comfortable, room safe, good shower, very comfy beds. The complimentary fruit in the room was a lovely touch, and much appreciated in sticky Rome, as was the free welcome cocktail in the bar opposite. We also took up their suggestion of eating in Mama Angelas downstairs in the evening on the terrace, where we got a free shot after the meal (the meal was ok, not fantastic to be honest). And the next day we were able to leave our case in their luggage room, locked up and safe, until we left. Really good experience, so nice to find a place like this in a big city! The free Ipad rental and wifi was a hit with my other half too! Would definately recommend without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location , Great Fun”
Reviews.Author: stonyplaintravelers
Reviews.Content: Location handy to Termini Station, central and easy to get to most sites in downtown Rome- walk, bus or metro. Very nice for budget hotel - breakfast across street at bar-cafe and at night thats where the fun is with all the youngsters from the Yellow Hostel above. Good restaurants nearby and overall made our rome visit great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel. I recommend it to all my friends”
Reviews.Author: MORI103
Reviews.Content: Sweet little hotel. Lovely hotel staff nice and courteous. The rooms are clean and excellent location. What could be better? And of course the most fair price

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic little find”
Reviews.Author: Kokonz
Reviews.Content: We were sure what we'd find when we got here,but were welcomed warmly and the beds.... Wow. So comfortable, which is a change from most hotels. I couldn't even get the kids out of bed they were so comfy. Room was a good size for a family of four and it was so close to everything. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: mah1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this great little hotel for a week. It was small, super clean, bathrooms were great w/ rain shower! Just blocks to Terminal and taxi's, and withing walking distance of the Coliseum, and all the other attractions Rome has to offer. I love the fact that our room " Tree" had a view of the typical Italian courtyard. So quaint. NIce restaurants and Yellow bar nearby. I'll definetely come back .

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!!”
Reviews.Author: TorontoTravelBugz
Reviews.Content: We didn't expect too much coming here, but when we arrived, we were greeted nicely. Room was available right away. When we arrived, there was fresh fruit complimentary in our room as well. Breakfast is not included, but they actually do have packaged croissants, tea, juice, coffee available in the morning along with fresh fruit, so that was a nice surprise too. The rooms are not huge, but they were clean and decently sized. The washroom was small, but expected of Europe. This was also a 10 min walk from Termini station, which was definitely very convenient if you need to catch a train to another city. Definitely great value considering the prices in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Central location, reasonable price, well managed”
Reviews.Author: Ysolde_voyages
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Romae occupies a couple of floors in an old apartment building a few blocks from Termini Station. The front desk staff are very friendly and professional. The rooms have been nicely decorated in a fresh, modern style. There are orginal paintings in a contemporary style of scenes of life in Rome throughout the hotel. The hotel has several energy conservation features, e.g., card control for power in room; the A/C in the room shuts off automatically when I opened the window. The wireless internet worked well. The neighborhood outside the hotel is full of small hotels and literally swarming with foreign tourists, but I was delighted to find that my room looked out into an interior courtyard and was very quiet, so I could get a good night's sleep. There are 2 decent sized grocery stores very nearby: a Spar in the Termini Station and a Conad in Piazza Indipendenzia.

Reviews.Title: “friendliest place in Rome”
Reviews.Author: mausgrass
Reviews.Content: we have just come back from 9 weeks away and first went into this hotel in early april for 3 nights....luvved it so came back on way to puglia and also returned to overnite on way back to Australia. we were treated like family and the place was busy. We also could leave our bags in storage so we did not have to cart the kitchen sink whilst doing the small trips. Good extras like 2 vouchers for cocktails at the Yellow bar across the road......the cosmopolitan was the strongest my wife had attempted. The breakfast was also by a voucher and was simple but filling.....or could be used as currency to up grade if a total fat attack was needed. Good area 4 blocks from the Termini so with all our movements no cabs needed. plenty of good restaurants nearby with our favourite being Mamma Angelinas 30 meters away. Thanks to Marco for arranging cheap transport from the front desk and good wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Great find!”
Reviews.Author: ammer
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Romae for three nights and couldnt fault the place at all. The staff were so helpful and approachable - nothing was too much trouble. The location was great near Termini and not far from all the main sights and the room was perfect. We got a tripple room on the inside which even came with a small balcony - it was perfect for us and spotlessly clean. We couldnt have asked for a better place for our trip and would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Good overnight choice near the railroad station.”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn
Reviews.Content: I had heard that the neighborhood near the Termini was dicey, but I wanted a budget hotel for one night because I was taking a train to Florence the next day. I checked several travel websites, including this one, and chose The Romae. The hotel is a few blocks from the train station, an easy walk with just a roll-on, especially after an overnight flight from JFK and a first ever use of the train from the airport. The street was clean and pleasant and the hotel exceeded my expectations. For a budget single, the room and en suite bathroom were spacious and clean. The desk clerk, a charming man with a Brit accent, was welcoming and helpful. Although breakfast is not included, there is fresh fruit and bottled water in the room. The rate was good because it was non-refundable, so well within my budget. The yellow bar across the street was fine for a quick coffee and cornetto the next morning and I made it back to the train station with time for an excellent cappucino. The city bus terminal, outside the train station, was convenient for getting a bus to my favorite neighborhood, so I spent the rest of the day and early evening walking and having dinner in that area. Returning to the hotel around 8PM, the streets from the bus terminal to the hotel were still tranquil and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best - not the worst”
Reviews.Author: nannyonthego
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not for everyone due to the stairs. There is a very small lift that holds a suitcase or two and one or two persons at a time. We had a room for 5 people - a quad room. Two sets of bunk beds and a double all in one room along with 1 bathroom. It was adequate for our group but may not be for everyone if you don't want to all sleep in the same room. The breakfast is served across the street and is very good. There is a pizza restaurant right next door that is a wonderful place to eat dinner. Very energetic place in close quarters - great food and great service. You might have to wait for a table but it's worth it and they give you a glass of wine while you wait! It's in a great location to get places around Rome. Would stay there again as stairs are not an issue for me but would maybe get two rooms for 5 people instead of all in one room.

Reviews.Title: “centrally located.. friendly staff.. Do not hesitate to live here”
Reviews.Author: robs_bergen
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in the neighbourhood of train station. We got cheap deals and we were very happy of what we got out of the price we paid.. Breakfast coupon were provided by the hotel and the breakfast in the restaurant located on the other side of the street was good.. When you come out of the hotel's main entrance and turn right and as you come to the first cross you find a nice italian restaurant which is cheap n good.. But there are many restaurants near to the hotel (we didn't try any other except one mentioned before). I will recommend to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great potential, but...”
Reviews.Author: ohemelia
Reviews.Content: First, the good. Romae is immaculately clean and nicely located near the Termini train station and two metro stops (and the best gelato in rome- I Caruso). The beds were comfortable, the bathrooms were new and the showers had great hot water and pressure. We were really excited to stay here! The bad made our stay pretty annoying. The hotel is essentially run by 22 year olds who we found to be pretty unhelpful. Our first night at the Romae we closed our window, in spite of the great breeze, because the courtyard we were situated on was pretty loud and every sound echoed. We turned on the air conditioning, only to be woken up in pools of sweat two hours later, when HEAT was blowing out! My husband went to the desk and the employee apathetically told him that it was too early to turn on the air (last week of April) and that there was no fan. He came back to the room and we opened the window again. An hour later, we were awakened by Billy Joel blasting from the room across the courtyard. Again, my husband went to the desk (it was 1:00am) and was told "it will stop soon," with no offer to ask the other guests to turn down their music. When the music didn't stop soon, my husband went into the courtyard, found a broom, and hit the window until they turned off the music. Every night there were noise disturbances (groups of touring high school spring break trips, for example) and the staff didn't seem to care that the entire building could hear the racket. The next day we inquired if the air in our room could be turned on, and a different employee said "oh, yeah, um, let me call the manager." She either never did call, or she never felt like telling us that he said "no, sweat it out with your window closed." Just a few SIMPLE improvements to customer service and this could be a great place, but for now, I wouldn't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: keki16
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The staff are very friendly and the service is excellent. Rooms are small but more than enough. The bathroom and shower were very clean. The location of the hotel makes it very easy to make use of the Termini station and we felt secure in the neighbourhood. Highly recommended and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back.”
Reviews.Author: GlenbeulahGal
Reviews.Content: With the many hotel choices in Rome, I am so delighted that we chose Hotel Romae. The room was very clean upon arrival and we were happy with the daily up-keep cleaning. Our linens were replaced each day if they were dirty and left out. The size of the room was just a bit larger than your typical European hotel. We had a quadruple room which consisted of two twin beds pushed together to make one large bed. Never had any issues with the "crack" in the middle. There was another twin bed with a portable cot type bunk bed. I was a bit nervous about it's stability but it held up to our two rambunctious kiddos climbing around on it. We had an issue with two of the mattresses. One was extra squeeky and the other was seriously concave. We brought it to the staff's attention and during their cleaning service that day they were both replaced. MUCH BETTER! This is a small hotel with about 7 rooms on the first floor. I was concerned about out children being too loud for our neighbors but to my surprise, the walls seemed to be quite soundproof. The doors that access the hallway however, were not. The last two nights we were there we had neighbors that were oblivious to the fact that if you hold the door after you walk through it, it won't slam loudly and disturb your neighbors. We did not use the television. We did use the complimentary tea, coffee and juice service in the lobby and it was always delightful. Also, we took advantage of the wi-fi through our American iphones. The hotel was in a great neighborhood. Easy walking to the Termini, a supermarket, restaurants, various shops as well as several atm. (I highly recommend the pizza place across the street from the hotel on the corner of Via Palestro.) Our only complaint in regards to our stay here was that their was a nasty sewer smell that came from the bathroom any time we would use the water. It didn't seem to matter if it was the basin, shower or toilet. We mentioned it to the staff and they did try pouring bleach in the toilet but it didn't help. We were informed that the building is quite old and it is not unusual for this type of thing to happen. They did offer to move us to another room but we were at day 3 of our 5 day stay and I didn't want to pack everything up, unpack then repack 2 days later. We just made sure we kept our window open when we were there to alleviate the smell. Every one of the front desk staff was extremely helpful. We asked directions, restaurant recommendations, taxi and transportation information, etc. and were always pleased with them. We will be returning to Rome and will definately call upon the Hotel Romae again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully modern and spacious”
Reviews.Author: Neena23
Reviews.Content: This was definitely one of the best hotels we stayed in in our 5 or so weeks in Europe. We stayed in hotel romae for 5 nights and were not disappointed. It was great value for money, prices include breakfast vouchers for the place across the road! Location's good, it's close to the termini train station, and a short walk to the main bus terminal, as well as the metro. Just be careful of some of the restaurants around the area - tourist traps!! The room we got (double) was fantastic, lovely bed, sofa, fridge, clean and modern bathroom - we were impressed. Only problems we encountered would be that although there was free wireless, signal wasn't all that great. And walls are quite thin, we had some very loud kids next door one night. All in all, great stay, would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Good location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: nik94
Reviews.Content: Good: location , staff members ,price,cleaning Not so good : breakfast , caracter Family management , in central location close the Termini railway station .

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is booked out for a reason!”
Reviews.Author: Lockybob
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just a short walk from the train station. The staff were very very helpful and cheerful. Unfortunately I could only get 1 of the 3 nights here that I spent in Rome because it was booked out and now I know why. The staff were most helpful in storing my bag before the check in time and had the room ready early, they also helped by booking another hotel nearby for the other 2 nights. The room was very clean and new looking even had complimentary fresh fruit on the bench, the best stay I've had in 9 weeks of travel for value, quality and service. Would recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: moushumi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to Termini station and is good if you have an early morning train to catch like we did. That said, I would not suggest the Termini area as a good place to stay as there is nothing much happening here - unlike Trevi / Spanish Steps/ Colosseum area. Moreover, to take the metro from Termini is tiring as you have to walk in a long maze and go up and down many steps. However, most hotels around the other areas are expensive and the Termini area is the next decent option. The hotel per se is a comfortable place to stay. Breakfast is served in a restaurant/bar in the opposite building. The vouchers you get complementary are for 7 euros. The breakfast option available for 7 euros is very poor but you can just add 1 - 3 euros and have a real wholesome breakfast. One drink is included. There is a room next to the reception where you can avail free internet and tea/ coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, stylish - a great little place”
Reviews.Author: Tibbles08
Reviews.Content: I didn't have high expectations as it was so close to the train station and was reasonably cheap, but I was really pleased to be proven wrong. It has had a recent refurbishment in an Ikea style (white, clinical). It was spotlessly clean and the reception staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast is served at the Yellow Bar across the road which is tremendously busy but serves a reasonable continetal breakfast (pay €1 extra for an omelette with toast). Some noise from the central courtyard where the bins are kept, but all in all highly recommended and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Mom062
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in busy Rome but the hotel is tucked on a street that makes the location seem like you are far away from the hustle and bustle. The staff is awesome. Very friendly and helpful. Always available to answer any questions you had. The rooms were clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Small room but clean, great price and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: mindfultraveller
Reviews.Content: We were lucky to get a reservation here after a large hotel chain notified us that they were moving us to another hotel because they were overbooked. And we didn't agree with their new choice, so found Hotel Romae myself. In the end it was a better location and better price which included breakfast across the street. Our room on the main floor was small but efficent and nice clean bathroom. I gather it is just luck for what is available when you check in for room size because another couple we met had a room that could have slept at least 4. The staff speak excellent english and were always helpful. You could use free wifi on your own computer in your room or a hotel computer in their common area. You receive vouchers toward breakfast across the street and there were adequate choices. The location was only a block or 2 from Termini there was also a taxi stand close by and a great grocery store. If you are looking for a high end chain hotel this isn't the place for you. Our room was very compact but we were out enjoying Rome and only here to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Romae is an excellent location for it's close proximity to the bus/train/metro terminal & nice restaurants”
Reviews.Author: berniemcguire
Reviews.Content: We arrived by bus from Borgo di Tragliata and Hotel Romae was within walking distance of the Bus Terminal. Staff most helpful on arrival and throughout our stay. Breakfast was served in the Yellow Bar across the road. For a euro or two extra you could have a full Irish/English breakfast. Breakfast served until 11.30am which was a plus. Mini bar in hotel room, no tea making facilities. There is a nice area adjacant to reception where you can make tea/coffee/herbal teas. There is also a cute smoking area just off this room. Hotel room very clean with ample supply of towels. In addition to usual toiletieries there was a shoe shine and emery boards. Only downside would be street noise. Keeping the windows closed helped but did not completely block out sound. All in all a good place to stay -

Reviews.Title: “LOVE the Hotel Romae”
Reviews.Author: hef4
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a recommendation of a friend. We are sooo glad we did. What a great "groovy" hotel. The staff was wonderful. They set up a driver to and from FCO. I highly recommend this as the metro is very busy. We were a family of 4. The first night we stayed in the Emperior Room. It was clean and comfortable. Then we headed up to Florence for a few days. We returned and stayed in a quad room with bunk beds for the guys. PERFECT. The hotel is located an easy 4-5 block walk from the rail station. Great neighborhood no worries walking around. The Yellow Line breakfast is the BEST deal. Add one euro to the free breakfast coupon for a great omlette with potatoes and toast. It will keep you going most of the day. We also went to the Yellow Line in the afternoon for a drink before dinner. Wonderful. Staff was very friendly and helpful. We HIGHLY recommend this hotel. We will stay there again when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: lamplighter_10
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated less than 5min walk from the subway, which is rare in Rome. Excellent staff, friendly, knowledgeable and helpful in all respects. The room could have been bigger, and the A/C could have been more effective, but they worked. The tv and the bathrooms were above average. They boast of free WLAN, you were give a username and a password, but there was no connection in the room, though we were on the first floor. You had to bring your laptop to the reception or to the restaurant across the street to make use of the free wireless internet. Reasonably quiet area, just a short walk to the Termini, where we arrived from the airport. The great staff is the hotels best asset. They recommends "Angela's" restaurant next door, east of the hotel, but we found the restaurant next door to the west much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel,well located”
Reviews.Author: Avid_traveller258
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights on arrival at Rome and a night towards the end of our holiday in Italy. The hotel is centrally located, 5mins walk from the Termini station and very convenient to get around the main tourist attractions. For a 3star in Europe, it is an excellent hotel. The staff are very friendly and helpful. We were particularly impressed by Fatima, who was very courteous and always willing to help. The rooms are cleaned everyday and there are free fruits in the rooms as well! We were lucky to be upgraded to a bigger room, which was perfect. Else I hear the rooms normally can be a lot smaller. Free wireless is available, but is only usable at their reception and not in the rooms. TV's in every room with satellite channels. I would recommend the hotel and definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I liked it a lot. Good inexpensive accomodations in a very expensive city”
Reviews.Author: puedeba20045
Reviews.Content: Tiny room with tinier bathroom. But comfortable bed and good air conditioning. Very clean. Free internet. Excellent big breakfast worth at least 10 euros served in a nice restaurant across the street. An extremely good value for the money.Very close to the main train station. Nice area. Hotel close to a self service laundromat, good bars and restaurants. Subway entrance nearby. English desk clerk, Mark, was extremely friendly and helped us plan our stay in Rome by marking up a map indicating best bus and subway routes, etc. This hotel is not suitable for disabled travelers. You have to climb 5 or 6 stairs to get to the lobby. Also, the elevator is very tiny, like 2 1/2' wide by 5 feet long! No possibility of getting a wheelchair in it. Good basic accommodations.Nothing fancy. Situated in a large building shared by 6 other hotels on different floors.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good Hotel, some good , some bad, like anything else.”
Reviews.Author: toela
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Romae for 3 nights. I think we lucked out cause our room was quite large. We had a double bed which was actually two twins pushed together, this is quite common for Europe, it was comfy though. Our room faced the street, but the special windows they have, do an amazing job of keeping the street noice out. The first 2 nights were great but the 3 night, as others have mentioned, there was quite a party at the bar across the street until 4 am.and it was a tuesday night? Even with ear plugs in it was pretty loud. I would not recommend this hotel for families. The rooms are getting pretty tired, but it was fairly clean.The free safe in the room is a bonus. They also had a nice welcome fruit plate in the room and a free drink coupon for the bar across the road. Rome is an expensive city and this is a budget hotel with a great central location, so we were pleased enough with the accomodations and think the good out weight what little bad there was. The bar across the street where you get your continiental breakfast, which was really yummy, is very much a youth hostle kind of place, didn't bother us at all but some folks might not like it? I might stay here again, but would ask for a room off the street! Happy Travels

Reviews.Title: “Noisy trap, awful beds in tiny rooms and very much overpriced. (but well-promoted)”
Reviews.Author: sequoya_travel
Reviews.Content: We booked and paid for a triple but got a tiny room with (actually) 2 children’s beds and one even smaller field bed. I am certainly not very tall but could not lie straight in my bed without my feet sticking out. Our 4 year old child even fell out of his very narrow bed at night (actually it was even more like a stretcher). We asked whether this was realy a triple and whether they had anything better. Reply: we can give you a bigger room but you will have to pay (even) more. We also asked for a quiet room but were give a room (not on the actual hotel premises) very near to a café which was packed with boozing and shouting teenagers (backpackers) till 4 a.m. so barely slept. When we arrived the Philipino / Aussie personnel seemed mostly interested to sell some tours and get us to eat in their (associated?) tourist trap restaurant - but without the old-fashioned flair of Italians. My recommendation: avoid this over-priced trap! There are much better places with far better value...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a few days sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: Traveltomoon
Reviews.Content: Stayed in hotel Romae in June 2010. Firstly the location is great - only 5 mins walk from termini station & you can be in any part of Rome within a few minutes. We booked a triple room which was small but perfectly adequate as we were out all day sightseeing. Our room was immaculate & had everything we needed. Would definately stay here again if revisiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: zicoian
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. We booked two rooms and were given two that were linked by our own little private corridor. The beds were comfortable, including the travel cot that was provided for our three year old (which had a proper mattress in it). The staff were very friendly and happy to help - they went the extra mile for us with a particular incident during our stay. The breakfasts at the Yellow Bar across the road were very good value; we particularly enjoyed the 'Fitness Breakfast' for a Euro extra. The location was extremely handy for the train and bus stations and we had good access to all parts of the city. We would certainly book here again if we are ever in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: kiwilynn
Reviews.Content: This great little hotel, 5 minutes walk from the Termini Railway station is a fantastic place to stay in Rome. The rooms were big - especially by European standards - very clean, air conditioned and a beautiful fruit basket on arrival. Rooms had a safe, fridge and a flat screen cable TV. Staff, especially Amelia, were great with nothing too much trouble. We had a mix up with our luggage (our fault) and Amelia worked far beyond her job description and sorted everything out. Breakfast is across the road at the Yellow Bar, which works well and is beat food. The hotel is surrounded by great cages, restaurants and bars, litter a Y 1 or 2 minutes walk from the hotel door. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel. Very hard to fault!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: sandy2500
Reviews.Content: We were very tired by the time we got to Rome but was pleasantly surprised to see that the hotel was just 5 min away from the station. Excellent location. The staff was very friendly. Infact my husband left his expensive glasses in the cab. He called the hotel and they tracked the cab . They sent it to us free of charge too. The day we had to leave , our flight was at 6.50Am.They packed us breafast when we told them about it. Yellow bar had good breakfast menu and Mamas Angela had good Italian food and treated us good. Had good time here. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place in Rome”
Reviews.Author: gaspi86
Reviews.Content: This was a perfect hotel. Great and very helpful staff, big rooms and bathrooms, air conditioning and working hi-speed internet connection. Room service was everyday, a welcoming "fruit fix" was provided free of charge.I would definitely recommend this hotel to anybody staying in rome. One negative side - the breakfast is provided at The Yellow bar in the close proximity of hotel, and it is not all-you-can-eat style. The bread provided everyday at constant supply was too hard to eat, but one can upgrade to omelette for 1eur addition.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Gibbyfan
Reviews.Content: Upon reading thousands of reviews my wife and I selected his hotel for our stay. After finding our way from Termini station we were very pleasantly surprised with our room. It was much larger than we had anticipated. It came with all of the standard items one would expect from a hotel. The room was spacious, comfortable and clean. The only draw backs that we saw was the glass shower leaked a little which caused a bit of water to collect. I would suggest maybe a larger TV in the rooms for evening viewing. Such a wonderful room would seem appropriate. The Star Bar across the street was also a great addition. It took the guess work out of finding some place to grab breakfast before heading out for the day. Thank you to the hotel staff for making the first leg of our vacation off to a great start!

Reviews.Title: “Air Conditioned, Friendly, Comfy, and Clean at the Hotel Romae!”
Reviews.Author: egoswick
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent four nights at the Hotel Romae in early July. We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful, especially with travel information within Rome. The rooms were well air-conditioned (something we didn't always find in other "air conditioned" hotels.) They rooms were also very clean. The rooms are not large, and the decor is spartan. One funny things is that there aren't top sheets on the beds... only comforters. We didn't mind though. A bit about the location: We ended up walking back and forth the the Termini station, for the buses, a number of a times a day while staying there. The fact that we could have our pick of about eight bus routes to take throughout the city, only a ten minute walk away, was very nice. I would warn others that the Hotel Romae is not smack in the center of the tourist sites though. It's a good ten minute bus ride (sometimes more) down to the sites, and the Vatican especially is a good hike on the bus. Technically you could walk to some sites (especially the Colosseum,) but it's not an extremely central location to the Campo di Fiori, Trastevere, or Piazza Navona (probably 45 minutes walking to those.) Also- currently there is no wireless internet. You must plug in for access (free though.)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: KMWilson
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a wonderful 3 night stay in the Hotel Romae. The hotel is in a great location, close to the Metro and Termini station but also within walking distance of some of the attractions. The room is not the largest but is perfectly adequate and has a small fridge which was great for chilling drinks. The hotel was spotless and everyday we got fresh towels (which were large and fluffy) and complimentary toiletries. The staff were friendly and helpful. The breakfast in the yellow bar was great. We upgraded to the hot breakfast which was worth the couple of euros more. Overall a great stay in a hotel which was great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: britgirl26
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 nights at Hotel Romae with my teenage daughter. This is a great location, within a few minutes walk of Termini station- ideal for a day trip to Pompeii ! The staff are first rate here, always happy to help and far more pleasant than many staff I have encountered in big chain hotels. Room was very clean, air-conditioned -a basic boutique hotel room. Yellow Bar worked great for al fresco breakfast withefficient service. We found the continental breakfast just right before heading off to see the sights of Rome. Don't hesitate if you are thinking of booking this hotel-good hotel at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “If You Want a Good Value hotel in Rome, You Want Hotel Romae”
Reviews.Author: NancyG_EC_CA
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at Hotel Romae for 6 nights in mid-June. The hotel is very conveniently located about a 10 minute walk from the Termini (Rome's main train station and bus depot) and Plaza Republicca. The neighborhood has several good trattorias and a takeaway pizza shop. We had two rooms in a building across from the main hotel office. The rooms were small, but not unpleasantly so, and had a nice bathroom. Rooms had good air conditioning, important since we kept the windows closed during the evening and early morning to block out street noise. Internet access was free in the rooms after a 5 Euro deposit (for the cable they provided) and they also provide a computer in their lounge with Internet access. Rooms were very clean and were cleaned daily. Rooms have a stocked mini refrigerator, helpful if you want to store leftovers or make your own lunch. Hotel office staff were all extremely friendly and helpful re: making reservations for day trips, making sightseeing and dining recommendations, providing directions, and in our case, helping us locate medical care for our son. Breakfast (continental or for one Euro extra, an omelette or muesli and yogurt) was included. This hotel was perfect for us since we didn't want to spend top Euro, and I would highly recommend it for people interested in a small, friendly, convenient, clean place to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great for A Budget Property”
Reviews.Author: FlashSydney
Reviews.Content: I have to say that I baulked when the car pulled up. The Romae is in a large former apartment building that houses three other hotels and B&Bs. However, we received a huge room with a renovated bathroom. Reading the other reviews, it clearly depends on which room you are given - all of which were converted from former apartments - as to how the hotel is rated. I, too, was aware of the funny smell when we arrived. I think this is more due to the sort of cleaning agents that Italians use rather then a desire to cover up anything. Once I opened the window - it vanished. We stayed for five days and it was like having our own small apartment in Rome. The staff are fantastic - organised airport transfers and tours, dealt with every query etc with charm and promptness. In a city known for its price-gouging, the Romae also stands out for offering free internet use, free coffee and tea round the clock, water in the room, really good toiletries that I wasn't expecting in a budget property and an in-room kitchen. The arrangement with the Yellow Room across the road for breakfast is very good. As another reviewer pointed out - for one euro more you can order a full English breakfast or omelette and the food and coffee is very good. Yes, it is close to Termini but that's fine if you are a walker. We walked all the way to the Piazza del Popolo without strain - let alone the Spanish Steps. I have to disagree with some of the reviewers re the surrounding restaurants. Two of them in particular - Mama Angela's and Il Leone di Abruzzo - should be avoided at all costs. The food and service are appalling in both. Farther down the street is Il Grappolo d'Oro - it's more expensive but the food is very good. Also nearby is a laundromat and several barbers and hair stylists if you have been on the road for a while.

Reviews.Title: “Kind of gross”
Reviews.Author: Travelat0r
Reviews.Content: They bill themselves as "groovy," but they would be groovier if their rooms didn't smell of some kind of masking agent (masking what, I hesitate to speculate--mold?). Pretty bad location in terms of all the sights (although convenient to a metro stop, bus routes, and the train station). People at the front desk are nice and helpful enough, but our room was just kind of gross. No lock on sliding bathroom door either. Not very good for privacy.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!! Groovy indeed!”
Reviews.Author: tiga_pinas
Reviews.Content: We visited Rome last June 20 and checked in at Hotel Romae for 5 nights. It was a very pleasant hotel, nothing negative to tell about. Hotel staff are very friendly and helpful. Even the staff at the Yellow bar are all friendly and approachable. The location is perfect, a very short distance to the Termini station. Hotel Romae made our stay in Rome. Hats off to all the staff and management of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: LJOHN01
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at Rome, also thanks to our stay at Hotel Romae. Our first day was marked with frustration as we had left one of our luggages on the shuttle bus and the Hotel Romae staff spent time calling the shuttle bus company and getting our luggage rerouted back to our hotel - many thanks to them!!! They also gave helpful directions except to the Villa Borghese but I believe thats a confusing path to take anyway. The Hotel was located on a very convenient few blocks away from Termini station where you could take the local bus or subway and also take the Treinitalia trains - we used the metro everyday so staying close by was key! Breakfast was good - almost everyday we upgraded to the omelet for 1 euro and its just a great bang for your buck! Room was pleasant - not the biggest, but very clean, great light and bathroom although small was very clean. We would recommend this hotel to stay in if you want a clean, friendly place to stay when most of your time is going to be spent sight-seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: csobrien
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here as our first stop on our Italian honeymoon. Mark, at the front desk, was very helpful when we arrived too early to check in; he got our room ready in record time, and gave us very useful directions on what we should do with the few hours we had to kill. Our four night stay was very pleasant. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. The room was kind of small, but that was not really a concern. Mark was even kind enough, after we had already left for Florence, to mail my wife's glasses back to the States when we forgot them at the hotel. Five stars for a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place - great folks”
Reviews.Author: edunahoo
Reviews.Content: This was a pleasant surprise for the money after searching for hours on line to find a decent place. They were very nice, great English, and worked with us when one of our party left early and adjusted our rate as well. Food is great (order the omelet and you can skip lunch) and very good. Room was good, bath nice, fruit basket nice gesture. I would definately stay here again if I return. Close to train station, metro (subway) and restaurants. The restaurant by Yellow bar was good for night meal and very friendly. Rome was great - you only need about three days if you go strong. Buy a Roma pass for free travel and 2 admissions...Oh, and you can park on the street, just pay the meter.

Reviews.Title: “Very modern, comfortable place to stay”
Reviews.Author: superkd324
Reviews.Content: I was surprised with this hotel. We had a triple room which was very spacious with a huge bathroom! The staff was very friendly and the breakfast over at the Yellow Bar was decent enough. For 1 euro you can upgrade to a regular breakfast. The restaurant right the hotel is very yummy and had some good pasta as well. I really liked that we were given fresh fruit in the room updon our arrival and had free cable as well. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ItalianBadger
Reviews.Content: Hotel Romae was a great place to stay! We had never been to Rome and the staff were first rate from the minute we booked online! We would stay again. Only a 4 block walk from the Main train, metro, bus terminals - great for getting around the city with ease. The front desk staff spoke great English, very helpful including warnign us that the Metro would be closed on May 1 for a period of time. The breakfast across the street (Yellow Bar) was served fresh & hot - the upgrade for 1 euro is well worth it! The lobby & courtyard area were awesome for Wi-Fi in the evenings to plan for the next day (or you can go across the street too and have a beer/glass of wine). Ther was a fresh basket of fruit - in room fridge equipted with a corkscrew too! Thank you Hotel Romae!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: dilan55
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the building across the street from the hotel, in a renovated room. Not fancy but served our pupose well. Loved the neighborhood, always felt safe. Restaurants next to hotel were very good. Laptop with internet for guest use came in handy. Hotel staff very helpful, always polite and eager to help in any way. Our room faced the road, and the only complaint I had was the noise coming from the Yellow Bar late at night. We are not light sleepers by any stretch of the imagination, but this kept us awake until midnight when things seemed to quiet down. I noticed a sign at the Yellow asking for quiet after midnight and that was usually when things slowed down there. If you don't go to bed before midnight, this won't be an issue for you, but if you usually retire before then, make sure you don't have a room facing the street. I would definitely stay again, although with a different room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: beenymac
Reviews.Content: My friends and I chose Hotel Romae after reading many positive reviews on Trip Advisor and we were quite pleased wtih the location within walking distance of Roma Termni and the excellent and attentive service provided by the multilingual staff. The rooms are simple and clean and we had free Internet access. There is a lounge with free coffee and tea. Breakfast vouchers are given for the Yellow Bar across the street and we were provided wtih quck service and good food. On our last day, we had to leave before breakfast hours, but the hotel staff offered to have our breakfast packaged for us to take with us. If I ever return to Rome, which I hope to do, I would definitely stay at Hotel Romae again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff - Went out of their way for me”
Reviews.Author: JerseyCityTraveller
Reviews.Content: I left my Armani reading glasses in a restaurant the night before leaving the country and I thought I'd never get them back. A hotel staff member went to the restaurant to retrieve them, packaged them up nicely and sent them to me in the U.S. via registered mail, paid for by the hotel. I am very grateful for this. Aside from that, I liked everything about the hotel. Clean, comfortable room with lots of storage, good beds, and an in-room safe. A free ample fruit basket upon check in, snacked off it for a few days. A sitting room near the front desk, with computer terminal and free tea and coffee. Well spoken staff to provide directions and make reservations for you. Good included breakfast, for only one euro you can upgrade to an omelet or healthy big bowl of meuseli with yogurt with fruit. Free drink included. Every morning we had the delicious cappuccino. The first day I knocked mine over and they immediately gave me another. Good location near the main train station. There's a convenient supermarket on the lower level of the station. The neighborhood is fine. Many good restaurants in the area. I highly recommend Romae Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kate41Banff
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, clean, comfy with great, accommodating, friendly staff. We had a room for my husband and I and our three kids. It was an easy walk to the Roma Termini train station where we caught an early morning train, we were going to miss breakfast, so they packed us each one to go in the morning - awesome!

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: The_Aviat0r
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel after careful research online and we were delighted with our choice. The location was excellent, only a short walk to the Termini station. The Termini area seems to have a bad reputation but we felt safe at all times and didn't have any bad experiences. The hotel had free internet access available in the room, which was nice, even though it was a bit slow. A fruit basket was awaiting in the room when we arrived. Breakfast vouchers worth seven Euros were included in the price of the room. For that we got a “continental” breakfast with a roll, croissant, marmalade, yoghurt and a drink of choice (the cappuccino was really good!). The street was quite noisy at nights due to some restaurants and bars right across, but we got used to it after a few nights. The staff was groovy, friendly and spoke fluent English. Overall, this hotel was excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable hotel w/in budget”
Reviews.Author: hkadviser
Reviews.Content: Pros : Price - Around HKD1,200 (incl ABF) / 3 beds / night (cheap due to promotion at that moment) Room - small, but enough for sleeping only. quite new and clean. Mattress & pillow - comfortable Location - around 15 mins on foot to the train & MTR station Cons : ABF - have ABF at G/F of another building (check in at another building too, but not the building same as ABF). Don't expect too much. Only coffee & bread, but delicious. No free internet Can't early check in, but you can put your luggage there

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and great location!”
Reviews.Author: jz215
Reviews.Content: The hotel was perfect! Very close to Termini (don't believe it if anyone tells you the area is dangerous, its not, i was with my bf but would have felt perfectly safe with another girl), the room was very clean with cathedral cielings and two extra beds (maybe we were just lucky?) a very clean, although not large shower, and even a free welcome fruit basket on our arrival! The staff are super friendly and are there 24/7 to help with reservations, tour info etc. They will even print out tickets or flight info for you if you ask them. Also, there were laptops you could rent for something like 1E/hour and a hot breakfast for 1E across the street at the Yellow Bar, also owned by the hotel. There is a supermarket at Termini, just 10 min walking that is open late, and tons of pizza places and restaurants nearby. Overall, couldn't have asked for more, definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Romae”
Reviews.Author: Victoria1273
Reviews.Content: Very quaint! Had to wait for the Hotel owners to wake up to let us in during the late hours.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic for those on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Jemjems-r
Reviews.Content: Hotel Romae was one of the best hotels that my boyfriend and I stayed in during our travels around Italy. It is easily accessible from the the train and metro stations and the directions supplied on the site made it even easier. The room was warm and perfect for two. The bathroom was new and quite upmarket for a budget hotel. Staff were friendly and polite and were happy to help out at any time of day even in the middle of the night. When we walked into our room the door just only opens without hitting the best but as I said it was perfect for two so don't let it put you off, there is free internet either for your own laptop or on the one supplied, there is free fresh fruit on arrival and it was the only hotel we stayed in that had TV with chanels that had shows in english. The breakfast was great across the road at the Yellow bar but it is worth paying 1-2 Euros more to get a cooked breakfast instead of the normal breakfast that is included in your stay. My boyfriend and I would highly recommend this hotel to everyone who is on a budget or who is just after a good, clean hotel to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Romae, great choice for romantic Rome ...”
Reviews.Author: murcat
Reviews.Content: Rome, what a romantic city!! Me and my husband stayed at Romae last November for just 4 days for a romantic escape in I have to say that I did not expect it to be that good. It had everything we needed... Location, clean rooms, helpful staff, good breakfast at yellow bar. At yellow bar continental breakfast was not priced for the hotel guests. It was satisfying also if you want you can have bacon and omelettes by paying just 1 eur more. Also there are many small and nice places to eat delicious Italian pasta & pizza aroun the hotel. I am sure anybody who will go to Rome will fall in love with this romantic city. We have already started to plan our second trip to Rome which will be longer.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive, modern and close to the train station”
Reviews.Author: JRG3
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for 7 people, 3 rooms at the last minute and were pleased with the hotel and the rooms. It is modern with free internet and the price includes breakfast at the bar across the street. It shares a buiding with another hotel and a B&B. Breakfast included is the standard crossiant and coffee but you can also order at extra cost the classic English full breakfast or eggs. The crowd is younger and mostly english speaking from Australia and England.. The 24 hr desk staff speak multiple languages. They were very helpful with all of our requests. The hotel is a 10 minute walk from the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: infla
Reviews.Content: This cute little hotel is located very close to Termini which allows you to travel easily to any place in Rome and other places in Italy. Convenient to airport transportation as well. Some rooms are a little small but very comfortable and the staff is excellent and very welcoming. Restaurants and shops are close by as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: travelerLP
Reviews.Content: First night stay while in Rome; had to book the whole room for the first night since my friend won't arrive the next day. Plus: 1) Great location: within walking-with-luggage distance. The area is safe at night, with restaurants/supermarkets around the neighborhoods. Definitely good for travelers who just arrive for the first night and need something to eat/shop and then rest first. 2) Room is clean and modern with all the necessary amenities. 3) Staff was friendly and helpful. 3) A common lounge offering free water and fruit punch. Mention this because many hotels in Italy charge you even for water, quite unthinkable for US travelers. Free, available water is definitely appreciated especially after a long flight. 4) Free, in room WiFi: definitely valuable. 5) Free basket of fruits: definitely appreciated especially after a long flight or just traveling. Minus: 1) The room I had faces the street. Though the room has soundproof windows, still was hearing quite audible ambulances/police cars with sirens zooming by at night a few times. 2) The AC is not quiet in the room. Need to have it on with windows closed while sleeping at night; for otherwise, the room smells/feels stuffy (don't know whether the stuffiness was the reason for the beg-bug-like bites on my lower right leg the next morning or the bites were due to the long flight on the plane....) 3) The breakfast across the street at Yellow Bar isn't a good deal: Yellow Bar advertises that the continental breakfast costs $7 euro. But this free breakfast rates below average in all the free breakfasts offered during my one-week stay in Italy through different hotels in different cities. Basically, just yogurt + drink + croissant + bread. It probably is more like a $4/5 advertised value, so that you would feel spending an extra euro for the omelet combo instead. Would prefer that Romae instead takes this cost out of the room cost so that I can easily buy a good $7 breakfast myself. 4) In-room WiFi doesn't work, so travelers prepare to bring your own Internet cables! (or you can put down $5 deposit and return the cable when you check out to get the $5 back. Sensible, but still an annoyance). 5) I didn't know this, but get your power adapters before traveling to Italy, otherwise, put down another $5 deposit to get the adapter and return to get the deposit back, too. Or just go to the supermarket in the Roma Termini station to pick up a $2.60 adapter yourself during your stay. Hotel staff wasn't helpful in informing that we can simply go to supermarket ourselves to buy the adapter. All in all: a 7 out of 10 stay. The room price can shave another $5 per night to match more its offered value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value,”
Reviews.Author: Essexboyz123
Reviews.Content: Brilliant hotel - booked on the back of many positve reviews on Trip Advisor and we weren't let down! Large room was plenty big enough for our family of 5 (although 5th bed is better for younger child). Great location, near - but not too near - Termini station. Looked like its been refurbished and very clean. Even a lounge with free tea/coffee! Great value breakfast just across road where continental breakfast is inc in room rate and cooked breakfast between €1-3 extra depending on how hungry you are. Also found staff extremely helpful - and good English spoken, even by the Aussie on reception:-)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel , AGAIN!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: herdwick
Reviews.Content: This is the third time we have stayed at this hotel and again we were not disappointed. The staff on reception are always freindly and helpful. Comlimenatary coffee and juice are available . The hotel may be a little out of the way of central Rome but is nof far from Termini whichi has a metro stop for both lines. A word of warning, for when you are out and about beware a gentleman pulling up in his little car purporting to work for a large fashion house with no cash for petrol. He offers to give you an article of clothing in exchange for cash.... it is a big SCAM... and we felt very silly afterwards, luckily we didn't give him much and have a very poorly made top to remind us of our niavity.... K&G

Reviews.Title: “Tiny but well-designed room in great location”
Reviews.Author: bryntrips
Reviews.Content: When we walked into our room I thought I had made a mistake in booking. The room is smaller than some people's closet. We couldn't even walk into the room without one of us ducking behind the bed to make room for the second person to enter. But the room is extremely cleverly designed, with nice storage options and a stylish and tidy bathroom. The bed was very comfortable with soft high-quality linens. The staff at the front-desk were helpful if not overly friendly. I was concerned from other reviews that the area around the hotel would feel unsafe, but we felt perfectly safe in the neighborhood. One night we walked to a nice little wine bar in the area (Tramani Wine Bar) and strolled back home rather late, which was fine. Our room cost E99 per night, including E14 toward breakfast each morning in the bar/restaurant across the street. We were able to walk to EVERYTHING in Rome from the hotel--it's a 5 minute walk to Termini station (where you can get the subway or train to airport), 20 minute walk to Colosseum. We even walked to the Vatican from Hotel Romae one day, stopping at many other notable spots along the way. Included breakfast is E7 at the restaurant across the street, which provided a serviceable, if not super great, breakfast. The restaurant is also a bar at night, so it was loud in the late evenings, but we never heard anything from our room. The last night we stayed at the hotel we returned to our room and immediately noticed a horrible sewer smell. We opened all the windows to try to air it out. I have no idea what it was but we closed the bathroom door and opened the window in the bathroom, which seemed to dissipate it slightly.

Reviews.Title: “excellent room, great service and indispensable location - what else do you need?!”
Reviews.Author: amiroi
Reviews.Content: first of all let me say that all of our trip was organised by this site so i know how much those reviews can help! after reading many reviews and cutting down to few that fitted us we decided to book at hotel romae and it was a great choice. we changed our travel date at the last moment and they were still willing to accept us without any charge. we got to rome early morning and our room was alreay set for us. it was our honeymoon and a little personal greeting note with wine and fruits waited for us in the room... during the whole trip they helped us with numerous questions that we had about transportation, places, opening hours and even a medical condition that we needed help with. the room was perfect (we were at room 17), all the electricity is being controld with the room card in a special slot.the breakfast at therestaurant across the street was also good enough for us. the hotel location is really indispensable, a max of 5 minutes walk from the termini station - a very importent thing in rome - there you can find any transportaion you want and switch over to any other kind. a tip: get out of termini station at the via mersela exit, it's the closest one to the hotel and you don't need to go through all the buses outside. the area is not at all unpleasent at night like some of the reviews here wrote!
