we got back every day very late and went out for dinner around the hotel without any hesitation. if you are looking for some good real italian food next to the hotel , go to viale castro pretorio (where the castro pretorio metro station is) and go left back to V.S martino d. battaglia. i don't remember the name of the place but it has 2 floors and on the entrance there are a lot of postcards on the inner wall. the "mama angelo" restaurant under the hotel is also fine and the pizza at the opposite right corner from the hotel is good.for conclusion, you won't be sorry if you book this hotel and thanks to the hotel staff: Marc, Deerhaj, Chester and evryone else!

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Hiddibiriz
Reviews.Content: perfect location, just 10 minutes walk from Train station(termini) and 2 minutes from metro, Yes, the hotel building may look weired once you first arrive, but don't forget that you are in rome with its old italian style building. Hotel rooms are bit small but very clean and beds are comfortable. Do not miss the break fast at yellow bar and try the tasty spagetti and steak at Taverna Pretoriana next to yellow bar. I should add that the staff are so friendly and helful and they can help you for available city tours with open decker bus. Our special thanks to Ms. Alice the manager,we had a pleasant stay and will stay in Hotel Romae in our next trip to Rome. Ciao!

Reviews.Title: “clean, friendly staff, good price”
Reviews.Author: Nehalos
Reviews.Content: - 10 minutes walking from rome main train/bus staion + 3minutes from metro station ''castropretorio'' :) - room is bit small, but clean + airconditioned - not expensive compared with other nearby hotels

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: Badger43
Reviews.Content: Location of this hotel is excellent for exploring Rome. Plenty of restaurants nearby and can reccommend pizza shop on the corner, our kids would have eaten there every night, given the chance. The hotel itself was clean, air conditioning was good adn the staff friendly. Breakfast at the Yellow Bar is a must!!

Reviews.Title: “brilliant”
Reviews.Author: bobbyrouge
Reviews.Content: i was worried that this might be a crappy hotel, some of the reviews had been poor, but as it turned out it was a fantastic place to explore Rome. Firstly its easily got to close 10 mins from Termini station yet in a nice are with no safety issues. Via palestro is a pleasant street with plenty of eating options. You will find that unless you want to spend 100 euros per person for the top restaurants in Rome, that basically all the restaurants serve the same choice. It like the rest of my experience of eating out in italy, is pretty mediocre cooking, i can cook better myself, but its ok and via palestro has many restaurants which offer you the same as the centre of town but at better prices. The hotel has no restaurant but breakfast is served up at the Yellow bar, which is good, and the bar is open all day until 2am and filled with you young back packer types so is quite lively. The rooms were huge, clean bright and modern, we were on th ground floor, and it both rooms were much bigger than anticipated. Staff were helpful and interested.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal Quality-Price”
Reviews.Author: Galactea
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nigths in the Hotel Roame and it was a great experience. It is pretty close from the train/bus station, and form there you can get anywhere in the city. The people from the Hotel were really helpful and nice, and the rooms were clean and brand new.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly, Great Service.”
Reviews.Author: bluenite85
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Romae for 3 nights, and it was a great experience. We got into Rome late, around 10:00 pm, and by the time we got to the Hotel it was after 10:30. Check in was super quick, and painless. They have a computer that you can use, just ask for a user name and password at the front desk. Breakfast is served across the street, and it pretty decent. There are quite a few restaurants near by on the street, and you are within walking distance to the train station. My boyfriend and I asked about moped rentals and they gave us a bunch of pamphlets on it, there was a place right down the block that had moped rentals for a decent price.. I highly recommend doing this, it was a great way to see Rome!! The room itself was clean and had nice cool AC. The elevator was a little slow, as its very old. The area is mostly filled with kids in their 20’s and the hotel itself has hostels, apartments and bed & breakfasts in the same building. The rooms were quiet though. The best part was that I had left a shopping bag with a leather jacket in it in the computer lounge, and they shipped it to me in the States free of charge! I definitely wasn’t expecting that! Great people, great value, great stay.

Reviews.Title: “if ur looking for a lovely stay in Rome, you will find in Hotel Romea :)”
Reviews.Author: Hobaboba
Reviews.Content: I' am from Egypt, I have been staying at this hotel during the period from 22/07/2009 till 30/07/2009 during my summer trip to Italy, and I have enjoyed my accommodation at this hotel so much, it had all what I was looking for and much more starting with the hospitality of your stuff to the great location at the center of Rome and of course near the termini station in addition to the prices, the cleanliness of the rooms, the facilities they offer like the free internet, the help of the information desk, all this made my trip much more enjoyable than I thought it would have been. it's located in an excellent location reletive to Rome main attractions and the Termeni station (only 10 min. to the station) this helped me to go to venice and florence as a one day trip as the train station is sooo near so i can come too late and its still safe. for the room prices i consider it cheap in comparison to other hotels the yellow bar where u get ur breakfast was also so lovely and just infront of the hotel I really had a great time there. Its one of the best's definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a night prior to travelling to Civittacvechia for a cruise and we wanted to be within walking distance of Roma Termini. Hotel staff were helpful in arranging a taxi from Fiumicino to the hotel on arrival. The room accommodated 4 - double plus a set of bunks- and was compact, clean and tidy. Only issue was the air conditioning. Rome was very hot when we visted and the air con in the middle of the night didn't seem to cool the room sufficiently. It wasn't a huge issue for us as we were only staying for a night, but if we had been staying a week it would have been a problem. The inclusive breakfast was nice (tea/coffee, croissants/bread, yoghurt, juice) and you could pay 3 euro more if you wanted to upgrade to a cooked breakfast. All in all good value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jenifersb
Reviews.Content: Positives: good location close to train station; friendly staff; clean and comfortable; internet access in rooms and in lounge; lounge with complimentary drinks; nice garden Negatives: A bit pricey

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms and bathrooms. Pricey!”
Reviews.Author: PetronellaS
Reviews.Content: Great location, near the big central train station. Nice rooms and bathrooms. The hotel offered a shuttle from the airport for a fee. We arrived about 11 am, and the staff were very nice and gave us our rooms earlier than the check in time. The breakfast was served across the street in a café/bar. The breakfast vas really good, they had about five different options to choose from, and the coffee was great! Pricey and clean, not a luxury hotel but great value for your money. We were a big family of nine - ages 18-78, and everyone was pleased with this stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Room with beatiful painting”
Reviews.Author: zelator
Reviews.Content: I have visited Rome several times both for biz and private purpose, I've also stayed Grand Palatino and I think Hotel Romae is even better than Palatino when you think about cost effectiveness. Clean room, bath room and everything was perfect for us ... I already recommand the Hotel Romae to my friends and colleagues for their own vacation. It was great experience at Hotel Romae. Ciao. :-))

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Romae where we made lifetime friends”
Reviews.Author: MyrtleBeachDays
Reviews.Content: Linda and I have stayed at Hotel Romae 4 or 5 times, and I am going again in Nov. 2009. Hotel Romae suited our needs, pricewise, location near train station, friendly staff, good brealfast, and free internet. Approx. Five years ago we made friends with Valeria. she is getting married in Sept. to Pierluigi. I plan to see them in Nov.09. Then Francesca and Luci owners,great couple,:they promised to visit us in USA: we are waiting: ) Then (Mimo) Sudan from Mamma Angela Ristorante, what a great friend. I look forward to seeing his smile. We adopted Valeria and Mimo as part of our family and keep up with them throughout the years. We go back often due to each of these friends. Amelia is having a new baby : )

Reviews.Title: “Good value, very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: ahmedkhan1
Reviews.Content: Nice, small hotel great for travelers on a budget who want a nice place. Inexpensive, but not cheap, it's not one of the four star hotels, but it's great for one or two nights, and is centrally located. The staff is very helpful and will help arrange tours, taxi's and give good recommendations. The complimentary continental breakfast is tasty and a great way start to the day.

Reviews.Title: “Great location fun designer rooms”
Reviews.Author: EasyandBreezy
Reviews.Content: The area around Termini train station gets a bad rap, but I do not understand why- especially the North section where Hotel Romae is located. The room we stayed in was newly refinished and had one of those huge show heads that are becoming so popular. Our room was a bit small so don't expect a palace but it was sufficient and the staff was friendly and helpful. Our WiFi was not working at the beginning so the IT Guy rushed right up and took care of it. If you stay there you get a 10% discount at the restaurant next door, which was a nice plus and the food was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Hotel, Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Pisceanne
Reviews.Content: Location : 2 Mins walk from Roma Termini, great place to stay in Rome - easily accessible from everywhere. With good places to eat around. Rooms : Clean and cosy. We got the room in the building opp the main reception. Only that if you have a lot of luggage, there is only limited space to walk around. Cleanliness : Hotel is nicely decorated. Food : Dont think they have their own restaurant, but have tea coffee some bread and juice available free for all residents all day. They also provide coupons for fresh breakfast at a cafe across the road, and discount coupons for nearby restaurants. Facilities : internet in the reception, hot water all day, pay-per-view tv etc Value : great value for money. we booked directly from their website, and got a cheaper rate for a double bedroom with attached bath vs. nearby hostel we were staying in before (double room, no bath).

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelingHorse
Reviews.Content: Hotel Romae actually added to our Rome experience! My wife & I liked everything about this hotel: 1. Location - Centrally located, near the Termini station 2. Attached bathroom with 24-hour hot water 3. Free internet access in the Hotel lobby 4. Interior room decor - Very cosy rooms with ample shelf-space to spread your stuff around. 5. Staff - Very courteous, helpful staff. Well conversant in English. 6. Breakfast included in room price. 7. Discount vouchers available from Hotel for some restaurants in the same street as the hotel. 8. Money changing services - Very competitive rates vs. the Western Union services (Western Union runs an absolute thieving operation in the guise of money changing in Europe!). And for all this, the rate was simply FANTASTIC - great value for money! We infact came to Romae after paying a much higher place for a crappy "Bed-n-Breakfast" without any breakfast & without an attached bathroom. A definite recommend for anyone visiting Rome! :).

Reviews.Title: “Never stay here”
Reviews.Author: Em_travelIreland
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with nine friends for three nights. The cleaning staff 100% stole jewellery from our rooms worth over 500 euro. We complained to the management and their reaction indicated that this was not a once off incident. We received no apology and the reception staff were not helpful in any way. I presume they are all involved in stealing and share out the stolen goods from their reaction. We ordered a mini bus when we were leaving to take us to the airport. A taxi turned up instead of a bus which was 30 minutes late. We were over an hour late leaving the hotel as we had to wait for a second taxi to come to collect us all. Rude and dishonest staff. We are a quiet group of girls who just wanted to visit Rome. We ended up stressed and robbed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay.”
Reviews.Author: BenMemphis_TN
Reviews.Content: My father and I enjoyed a three night stay at Hotel Romae from April 23rd-25th. We were very impressed with the helpful, English speaking staff. The room was wonderful: clean, bright, and with consistently very fast ethernet. The location is excellent. Access to the Yellow Bar across the street for breakfast and drinks was nice too. The place has an upbeat feel with lots of friendly international staff and guests coming and going.

Reviews.Title: “All we wanted in a hotel we got”
Reviews.Author: ignitemusic
Reviews.Content: Arrived to an English speaking receptionist where we were shown to our room which was also on the same floor. Though the area surrounding is full of hotels which look identical, this hotel was perfectly fine for the purpose of our trip, which was to sight see rome and get a good safe place to sleep at night. The area at night around the hotel was safe to walk, the interior of the rooms were all white and clean including the sheets and bathroom. There is also a wifi room and a computer in the common room with tea coffee and juice which was a bonus, although the wireless did not reach all the rooms, we easily used one of the unsecured networks around ;) Would definitely stay at this hotel again if i returned to Rome, although not likely as i found northern Italian cities to be more cleaner and friendlier with better things to do.

Reviews.Title: “wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: whileitravel
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel via the Italian train website which claimed the hotel was a 3 star. In actuality its a 2 star. The price was hard to beat, given the season and some other reviews I gave it a shot. While I don't stay exclusively in 5 star hotel, I believe they should all have minimum standards as a start. The place was clean & the staff useful on admission. The room however is very cramped. Dogs barking throughout the day & night at times was a drag. When the folks staying next to me were arriving at 1am everyone else staying on this floor knew. The TV is last century, not that I'd be watching exclusive Italian content anyway. Its saving grace for entertainment was free Internet. Room cleaning is apparently done every other day. You get what you pay for, took a gamble and got what I had coming to me.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and stylish great value”
Reviews.Author: theresagreen_84
Reviews.Content: We were fortunate to get a newly renovated room on the 4th floor which was much nicer than we anticipated. Beautifully designed room, white sheets, tv, hanging space, modern shower and even a small balcony. For the price this is well worth it, as it even includes breakfast at the adjoining bar across the road. I would recommend this hotel to stay at due to the location and value for money. There is a lift and small area with tea, coffee and orange juice. Internet either beside reception or with a cable in the room. A very comfortable and enjoyable stay. I would recommend exploring the small trattorias around the area rather then mama angelos, as it was overpriced and not a true italian experience. I ate at the smaller trattorias, although not stylish in interior but the food was delicious and found the price so cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: originalmorph
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from Rome and our stay at the Hotel Romae I have to agree with the majority of the reviews on this hotel. We found very little negative about the hotel. Like a lot of properties in Rome the Hotel has a shared entrance. The reception is on the first floor (second floor if you’re American) we found all the reception staff we encountered very friendly. In a small room just off the reception the Hotel offer complimentary coffee, tea and juice along with free internet for guests. The bedrooms were of a reasonable size, comfortable beds; our room was painted in soft colours with nice drapes. The rooms have a small TV with a Sky digital box. There was also a facility to connect a laptop to the internet. The shower room was very clean as was the linen, changed daily if you wished. The price we paid included continental breakfast which is served between 0700 and 1100 each morning in the Yellow Bar just across the road. On check in we were presented with one card per person per day for the value of seven Euro, which you in turn presented to the staff in Yellow. Unlike the reviews of other hotels where guests found very little left if you didn’t get down early, the Romae/Yellow Bar plated theirs individually which were quite substantial. You can pay the difference if you wish to opt for a cooked breakfast. The day we left it was too early for breakfast, when we checked with reception the evening before they said that this was no problem, when we checked out the following morning our breakfast was in bags for us to take with us, Great service! If we were ever to go back to Rome we wouldn’t have any hesitation in booking the Hotel Romae.

Reviews.Title: “Great little place”
Reviews.Author: Slenny
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three night stay at the Romae and it was great! The hotel is located about 5mins walk from Termini station in a business type district around the corner from the German embassy. There are several good value restaurants/pizzerias in the area and if you want to travel more into the centre of Rome it is only 2 or 3 stops on the metro from Termini. The hotel itself has very friendly and helpful staff, the rooms are clean if a little on the small side, but have recently been refurbished so everything was virtually brand new. The bathroom is a good size and well stocked with shower gel etc. The room even had a great range of satallite telly! Breakfast is served in a cafe across the street & is adequate but nothing to write home about Only complaints really are that we heard a lot of noise from the room above, bed is a bit on the short side (we're not tall people!!) and the pillows are terrible! That aside it is a great little hotel at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Keep that Smile”
Reviews.Author: Clinton83
Reviews.Content: We would like to thank you for making our stay in Rome a pleasant one. We were looking forward to stay at your Hotel but we honestly did not think that we would enjoy it so much. Next time that we visit Rome, we will surely use Hotel Romae!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: LinzGtravel
Reviews.Content: Quite noisy, but besides that, no complaints!! The staff was very, very friendly. They even helped us use the internet a couple of days after we had left the hotel when we had missed our flight. I would certainly stay here again. The rooms were very clean, and the location was excellent--a 10 min walk from train station.

Reviews.Title: “Good for alone traveler”
Reviews.Author: Aidudu
Reviews.Content: You could reach it by foot from Termini. Cheap. Very small rooms. Not a problem if you use hotel for sleep only.

Reviews.Title: “Great price for 6 people”
Reviews.Author: FH8
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay in this hotel. We had one room for 6. The only thing I didn't like about the hotel was the smell of the linens. They had a strong stale smell, but it seemed that this was due to the scent of the detergent they use, not any lack of cleanliness. Although I was surprised to find one queen bed and two sets of bunk beds that folded out of the wall (we got the room through Venere.com and Venere didn't state that two people would be on top bunk beds), the room was a nice size (for European standards). The bathroom was clean and modern. There was free wireless access in the room and lobby and a computer for complimentary internet use that was usually unoccupied in the lobby area. Orange juice, coffee and tea were available in the lobby 24/7. Breakfast wasn't great, but since it was included (and many other hotels charge 12-17 Euros), I couldn't complain and it was a good enough way to start the day. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful in answering questions about whatever we needed (public transportation, a good place to eat, supermarket, monuments/tourist sites, etc.) and were also very responsive to requests for more towels, pillows, etc. The hotel is conveniently located within walking distance of two different metro lines and the central train station, which is really nice. The area seemed saturated by hotels on every street (because it is so close to central station?), which gave it more of a touristy feel. I would highly recommend this hotel based on the price, proximity to public transportation, cleanliness, and great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Made our trip to Rome”
Reviews.Author: DidiWesternAustralia
Reviews.Content: My mate and I aged 22 stayed 4 nights here. It was the perfect spot for people our age. It is located in a backpacker type area with all the benefits of a hotel, including air conditioning! The hotel manager was sensational in his help of where to go and what to do. A terrific experience and a great time. Highly recommend it to all young travellers who want something more than a bacpacker experiece at a very affordable cost.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find for $$$!!”
Reviews.Author: rebeccasosa
Reviews.Content: Hotel Romae My husband and I visited this hotel in April 2008. We had a wonderful stay! The Hotel Staff was so very nice and polite. Prior to our stay we advised them that we celebrating out 10th Year Wedding Anniversary. And we had a nice bottle of Champagne and fresh fruit and 2 complimentary coffee mugs in our room. Before I arrived I emailed them asking for directions from the airport on the Metro. They were very prompt with their response and gave me great directions. Check-in was a breeze. The rooms are small, but that is common for Europe. The room was very clean and neat and the bed was super comfy. The hotel room keycard must be inserted into the wall as you walk in to turn the lights on. We were lucky to stay in the new renovated rooms. (See pics). Breakfast was included in our rate. You get the coupon cards and you go across the street and have breakfast at The Yellow Bar. A basic European continental was included, but we upgraded every day for an additional 2euro, that included eggs, bacon, and potatoes. They served best cappuccinos. It was delicious! Getting Around This hotel is about 4 blocks from the Main Termini station in Rome. You can take the Leonardo Express (12Euro) to the Termini Station and walk. We walked with our small uprights and it was a comfortable walk. But beware the streets are mostly cobblestone. Hotel Romae is also 2 blocks from the Metro Station Line “B” “Castro Pretorio”. That line will take you straight to the Coliseum (2 stops away) It’s so easy to get around in this city. We were there for 5 days and never took a taxi or bus. We walked and took the Metro everywhere. There are a lot of restaurants, cafes and bars in this area. Very metropolitan. You can be closer to the main sites but it will cost you a pretty penny. Especially since the Euro is kicking the dollar’s butt!!! Airport Transportation: To get back to either airport you go to the Main Termini Station and take the Shuttle (Greyhound type bus) 6euro. I believe they run every hour. This place was great and we had an awesome time in the Eternal City!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: weisertravels
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Hotel Romae for 2 nights. We booked the hotel from the hotel reservation desk at the Roma Termini for a very good price so we didn't know what to expect. We were pleasantly surprised when we arrived. Our room was a recently renovated room with plenty of space for the two of us. The room was very clean and had everything we needed. The reception staff was helpful and a basic breakfast was included across the street at the Yellow Bar (also a wonderful bar). The hotel is within walking distance to the main train station as well as a metro stop and great restaurants (the Mama Angela's next door was good too!). We prefer to walk everywhere and we were able to get most places on foot. We highly recommend staying at Hotel Romae.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service level”
Reviews.Author: Maria050
Reviews.Content: Date: 29-6-2008 Reviewer: Stella Maaswinkel From the 4th until the 7th of June, my mother and myself stayed in the Hotel Romae. Our room was not big, but very comfortable and they took our preferences into account: we had asked for a quiet room with a double bed; we got both. The hotel is situated near the Terminus station and in the neighbourhood there are a lot of trattorias where you can eat on the terrace. The staff of the hotel was very friendly; on several occasions we asked some information about buses and so on, and they were always eager to help us. But we didn't know what was yet to come. On the last day of our stay, we had booked a boat trip that would last until 12.00 hours. We had arranged for somebody via the travel agency to bring us to the airport; this person would pick us up at 14.00 hours. Time enough, we thought. Unfortunately, only one day before, the agency warned us that we would be picked up one hour earlier. This meant we probably had to get back to the hotel in a hurry after the boattrip. And indeed, of course the trip started and ended later than it should, so we hurried back to the hotel. Our luggage stood ready in a special room. We only needed to go to the bathroom and then we could get into the waiting car. So I went into the bathroom, but left my camera in the room with our luggage. My mother told me later that in the mean time, somebody took his luggage out of the room. My camera must have fallen onto the floor by then. Any way, we took our luggage and got into the car. And only when we arrived at the airport, I realised my camera was missing. I called the hotel, and luckily they found it and would put it into their safe. Back in Holland, I sent an e-mail with my home address to the hotel. And guess what: they sent me the camera back by recommended post and we didn't have to pay anything! So we really think this hotel has an outstanding service level, and we would like recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Brand New Rooms”
Reviews.Author: mt19580
Reviews.Content: We found the name of the Hotel on internet. The place is very well situaded, just a few minutes walk from the termini ( less then 10minutes). The staff his very helpfull, we got the chance to stay in there new room that ad just been opened, absolutely great. We only staid for two night, but most likely on or next trip to Rome we will go back. The hotel gives you a voucher for breakfast across the street restaurant Yellow very good also. The metro station is at the termini, a large grocery store near by with a big wine choice. The restaurant MaMa Angela, is next door the food is great.

Reviews.Title: “I would recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: Chicagotraveler76
Reviews.Content: I read some of the reviews of this hotel before I booked it and was a bit nervous, but once I got there I realized that the hotel was better than I expected! As a single traveler, I stayed here for 5 days and thought it was perfect. I wanted to stay at a luxury 3 or 4 start hotel, but couldn't work it with current USD and my timing for this trip. This hotel was such a relief for my first time to Rome! I arrived late into Rome from Termini and had a short walk to the hotel. The front desk was incredibly nice and welcoming. I stayed in a very nice and CLEAN room, which had been recently remodeled. Because of the recent remodel, one of the automatic lights in the room was a little touchy, but the staff and I think it was the manager, was very attentive and helpful. I liked the location because it was near (but not too close) to Termini for all of my day travels and also in a safe neighborhood with enough decent restaurants. I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: suhadDubai
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel from the Rome Termini. it was very close to the Rome Termini and close to every thing in rome. close to the train station, bus station even to the spanish steps and the shopping streats there. I loved the hotel, very clean, confortable and the people working there are very helpful. David who was the manager of the hotel is very nice person to deal with and helpful becouse of the nice hospitality of the hotel and the staff I decided to stay again in my trip to rome July 08. if you want to stay close to every thing in rome specially to the train station the best hotel is Romae to stay in. very safe to a female travelling alone to Rome. besides,

Reviews.Title: “Very dissappointed!”
Reviews.Author: kunalima
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our 10 day trip to Italy. We selected Hotel Romae through tripadvisor and booked it for 4 nights at a 175 euros rate per night. When we arrived there we were completely shocked by the hotel, particularly the room and the bathroom. It was not even a two star hotel and we are not picky. We had been in three previous hotels in Italy and were very sattisfied with all of them. The room was incredibly small, needed painting and smelled badly. After an hour, we went out and checked other hotels in the area and the three we checked were better. We moved to a hotel a block away with a much much better room and for almost half the price. We told the manager that we wanted to leave and he asked us to pay one night. We were so dissappointed by the hotel that we prefered to leave and pay the 175 euros tha stay there one night!

Reviews.Title: “Good location for one night with access to Roma Termini”
Reviews.Author: CarolynAZ
Reviews.Content: This is a very small hotel in an okay location. It is close enough to walk to the Termini which gives you access to everything. That is about it. The rooms was clean, simple and for being in Rome not the worst price as we had to accomodate 4 in room. We only spent our last night here as we had toured other parts of Italy (including Rome) prior to departure. There are restaurants in walking distance but I felt much more comfortable about walking around the Pantheon neighborhood than this location. Works for a night. If you need breakfast before 7:30 for an early departure I suggest you decline the included breakfast (that they charge 7 Euro per person for). They would not refund me and breakfast wasn't available before we had to depart.They substituted the equivalent of a hostess crumb cake for breakfast and called it even. Try to avoid this charge.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for a bargain break”
Reviews.Author: AttitudeAdjuster
Reviews.Content: I contacted Hotel Romae after they came up on the Late Rooms website. They replied extremely quickly offering me a double room for single occupancy @ 50 euros a night, or 65 euros if there were 2 of us. I thought this was a great bargain so took my partner on a surprise 3 day break (I did note that the price went up to 119 euros on 1st March). Everything ran smoothly and the room was well equipped even if the bathroom was small and the shower tiny. We got to use the fridge as there was a complimentary bottle of bubbly as well as some fruit when we arrived. The bed was very comfortable and we slept like the proverbial logs (must have been all the walking around this fascinating city). The location isn't great but you can walk to all the sites. We took in the Trevi Fountain, the Parthenon and Piazza Navona, arriving at St Peter's in time for lunch (and an excellent Vatican tour with Icon Tours). Do beware of the taxi drivers outside St Peter's though - definitely rip off kings. Especially with the Metro quite close by for just 1 Euro. The hotel organised a very reasonable taxi for us when asked and we also went with their airport transfer service which I think was well worthwhile. They were very helpful at all times and did our on-line check in for the return flight, though they also have a free internet set-up for guests to use. The restaurants in the Via Palaestra seemed very reasonable and our rate included the buffet breakfast at Mama Angelas. Whilst you might want to stay somewhere more "in the thick of it" if there are the kind of bargain rates we enjoyed, the Romae is well worth your while.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: SydneyBarney
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel mainly because of its location and budget price (paid under 60 euros per night). It was about 7 mins from Termini station which was very handy for trips out of the city or for getting around central Rome. We were initially hesitant about staying around the Termini area, but the side of the tracks that this hotel was on great and we felt safe at all time. To our surprise the location was also convenient for eating options which great as we arrived at about 10.30pm on the first night. The restaurant directly opposite the hotel had fresh pasta and there was a cheap and cheerful pizza shop on the corner of the street. The room itself was adequate. Nothing to write home about, but it did the trick - clean, comfortable, serviced daily. The only glitch was the initial check-in process whereby we were told that our room was not in the main part of the hotel, but is in an apartment block across the road. We were walked to the building by the receptionist but had trouble getting into the room, so we waited outside for about 15mins (when it was late at night and we had just flown in) for him to sort out the problem. Must be some recent extension. They only seem to have a small number of rooms in the block and the rest are residential or boarding rooms. From what I saw of the hotel pictures, they were exactly like the quality of the main ones. It turned out good, as I think it was much quieter.

Reviews.Title: “up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: JJo15
Reviews.Content: I booked after reading the reviews on trip advisor and Hotel Romae was up to our expectations: The room was sufficiently big, clean and quiet. The hotel is close to train station and at a walking distance from city center sightseeing main spots. Prices are reasonable. Staff was professional and kind even if we didn't have real problems they had to cope with. Lobby is very small and simple.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service”
Reviews.Author: esaha
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel, with clean rooms, excellent service and close to the railwaystation and other sights. Perfect for those that just want a nice, clean and sheap hotel for their stay in Rome. The hotel also has a really serviceminded staff that makes your stay even more comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Last Evening in Rome”
Reviews.Author: MartiJCO
Reviews.Content: A short 10 minute walk from the Termini Station and we found Hotel Romae nestled in the quiet streets of Rome, Via Palestro. It's location was wonderful, affording us the convenience for our last evening in Rome to walk the streets and visit (and re-visit)some of the nearby sites we had missed earlier in our trip. The charm of the hotel with a courtyard entrance and quaint elevator to the rooms added a cultural feel that most modern hotels cannot offer. The staff in reception were wonderful and very cordial and accommodating. The room was spacious, nicely decorated, and clean; and we had a wonderful night's sleep before departing early the next morning to catch our train to the airport. Aside from leaving before the complimentary breakfast at the restaurant next door was served, we couldn't have asked for a better place to stay before saying "Arrivederci, Roma!"

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Romae is great choice at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: AbruzzeseOlivePicker
Reviews.Content: Finding an affordable Hotel that's comfortable to stay in while in Rome has always been a challenge - with the declining power of the dollar, it's only become more difficult. Reading up on the Hotel Romae here and on LateRooms led me to believe they'd meet my expectations... but they far exceeded them. Communicating with the Hotel directly gave me a better rate than I found anywhere else, and all replies were prompt & helpful. Directions given from Termini were easy to follow, and it's a relatively short 4-block walk in a populated area to the right of the station. The check-in area is cute & very functional - coffee, tea, & hot milk fill 3 carafes in the bar area where there is also a computer for guest use. I found these to be available whenever I needed them, sometimes with no wait at all. As I chose not to pay extra for a fuller breakfast next door, I was very happy just to have hot drinks available - but juice is provided, and a small selection of packaged croissants & snacks was included during my stay as well. The rooms are arranged on the 4 upper floors - I was in a large single on the 4th floor. (404) The view was of the inner courtyard, and it was a quiet, spacious place to stay for 2 nights. The hotel carries the decoration style of its logo thru' all the rooms with the same artist's paintings, which made it very warm & inviting to return to after a day out in Rome. The bathroom was large, with a full bath, and all toiletries are provided - as well as a complimentary basket of fruit that was a very welcome gesture! (There is a mini-bar fridge, too) I found everyone at the front desk pleasant & helpful - providing maps, answering all questions ... even looking up local music events on line. Given the location, one can easily walk to the Colisseum and the Roman Forum, but frankly I found all the sights within acceptable walking distance from the Hotel and never felt unsafe at night upon returning. (Tho' all the usual precautions of travelling in any big city still apply) The bed was a standard European King Size (2 twins set together) and was very clean & comfortable ... when I return to Rome, I will definitely be returnung to the Hotel Romae!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Romae was Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: hallaway
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Romae for a short break with my sister -in-law and mum-in-law. It was great! It's in a great location, away from all the problems of Termini Station but the closest Metro stop is only 2 blocks away - or if you're in better shape than us, you could definitely walk to the City Centre in about 15 minutes. The staff were very warm and welcoming and spoke English well. Our room (108) was a quad but there were just the three of us - plenty of room and closet space. The bathroom was nice as well, with soaps and shampoos and a GREAT shaving mirror that seriously showed every hair/blemish on your face - had a lot of fun with that. ;-) Free Tea/Coffee was available in the lobby as well as free internet access, and there was a great little sitting area outside (accessed through the lobby). Water was available for €1/bottle in a cooler in the reception area. We opted not to go for the b&b at Mama Angelo's and I'm really glad about that - we had dinner there the first night and sorry, it was horrible food. (Waiters were nice, but the food was pretty awful.) There is a Bar Yellow across the street from Hotel Romae which is great for a coffee/tea in the morning and a wee drink at night. The beds were comfortable and the rooms had free Sky - there was also a fruit basket on the table when we arrived. It was very clean and the maid service was wonderful each day. The decor was tasteful and in line with our expectations of Rome. We were very comfortable in Hotel Romae and it's a great bargain. I was a wee bit nervous about staying in the Termini area but this hotel and its surroundings were safe. I would definitely stay in Hotel Romae again...and I highly recommend it to anyone going to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rick4q
Reviews.Content: We have been to Rome before & this is the best hotel for the price. Great location close to the train station,great staff & good breakfast, by Italian standards. The staff was very helpful,free internet,good restuarants close. Will stay at Hotel Romae again when going to Rome

Reviews.Title: “Mixed impressions of Hotel Romae”
Reviews.Author: Love2travelSydney
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights at Hotel Romae over 2 separate stays and it was overall quite good. I'd booked directly with the hotel via email and found them to be very quick to respond. Positive points concerning this hotel: Great location just 3 or 4 easy walking blocks from the Termini railway station; nice, very clean and cool rooms with tall ceilings; our queen size bed was two firm single beds together which gave plenty of room; small fridge and small safe in room; small fruit basket on arrival (a nice touch); free internet access in the reception area along with tea/coffee available all day; ample supply and good variety for continental type breakfast (in the restaurant next door). Staff were friendly and helpful. They even allowed us to store 2 large suitcases while we ventured to Northern Italy for 4 nights. The location provided for a choice of several good restaurants/trattorias/pizzeria in the immediate area, a laundry-mat and of course the pub opposite. Overall it was good value for money. The only disappointing thing concerning this property was that our second stay was in a room at the front of the property over looking the road and the pub opposite and this made for a very noisy night, despite it being a Sunday night. Our room for our first stay was towards the back of the property and much quieter. Their pillows are also very poor being very hard and flat. Asking for another one didn't solve this issue and it is probably time they replaced them all. But in hindsight this is only a small thing really. Would I go back to this hotel? I'd probably look around and try an alternative if we should ever get back to Rome, but having said that I still recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Romae - best of the rest!”
Reviews.Author: Vicky_Sorsby
Reviews.Content: We only stayed at Romae for one night, but i was really impressed with this hotel, especially as we paid only €80 per room per night! i got this price when i emailed the hotel directly to enquire about availability; they actually offered the choice of €80 b&b or €70 without breakfast - which i thought was really good too (we did note that the room info had it down at €210 per night!). Myself and friend had a twin room, our friends a double, both en-suite and exactly as requested. Both on the 3rd floor (there is a lift thank god!), the double was looking onto the street and the twin was onto the back of the building with a nice little balcony, unfortunately we didn't have chance to make use of it! The rooms are nicely furnished and comfortable with air con, Sky tv, a phone, fridge and fresh fruit. The staff are friendly and helpful, the place clean and quite stylish. Breakfast was buffet style in Mama Angela's restaurant next door, we only paid a flying visit for a cuppa and a slice of toast, but it seemed really nice and we sat outside for a few minutes before making the short walk back to Termini for our pick-up.

Reviews.Title: “This place is great!”
Reviews.Author: StephenReilly
Reviews.Content: If you're planning on spending a few days in Rome you could do a lot worse than checking out this gem of a hotel. It's hidden away on a quiet back street within a short walk (5 mins) of Termini train station so you'll find it easy to get around the sights. Rome isn't a huge city but there can be a lot of walking involved so get yourself a bus and rail pass to take the weight off your feet when you feel like it. The hotel itself is lovely. I was very tempted to skip an afternoon's sightseeing so I could just lounge in their courtyard garden reading a book! The rooms were light and airy and spotlessly clean. The staff were really helpful with any questions we had and they really made us feel at home. Breakfast served next door in Mama Angela's restaurant was typical continental style, nothing amazing but perfectly fine all the same. It's definitely worth a look if you're thinking of spending some time in Rome...I'd quite happily stay there again if I go back.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: mamakudu
Reviews.Content: Romae is quite hard to review , so I'll break it down to basics. We had 5 nights there. good - friendly staff; clean rooms; proximity to the station; good food in the area, Mama Angelos night time restaurant is excellent; fruit basket on arrival;discount cards for dinner at Mama A's; empty fridge for own use;free tea, coffee and juice in lounge; divine pizza's across the road, sold by weight;goodies in bathroom, not even found in some of the more upmarket places we were in; bad - rooms are tiny (well, ours was), bathroom even smaller (1m x 3m), and you had to sit on the loos sideways!; free tea coffee and juice always either empty or cold (nice idea tho); there are other hotels in the same building, so it's quite noisy. Our first night we were kept awake by a school group which apparently came from another hotel;the lift doesn't always work, we were on the third floor and it was a big ask to get up those stairs for some of us;we were a little iffy about the area after dark, so we liked to be back in the immediate vicinity by then, but that just may be our South African paranoia coming to the fore; Our overall impression is that for a budget hotel the Romae is an excellent bet. if you're not bothered any of the bads above it's a brilliant little hotel. If you like things a little more up market, and would like to experience more of the Roman nightlife, perhaps it would be better to head further away from the station. Note: breakfast neither bad or good - adequate enough, but things were not replenished when they ran out, so we often didn't eat very much. Early Breakfast (for those leaving early flights/trains) is a stale roll, and coffee (the latter was very very good!). I wouldn't bother. Note 2: Mama A's plays R & B/Hip Hop top volume, same song all the time, day and night!! Unless you like to listen to "I'm Hot, I'm Hot' a million times over, either sit outside or go somewhere else, there's plenty of choice!

Reviews.Title: “Romae swings and roundabouts”
Reviews.Author: nancarrow1
Reviews.Content: As others mention, the staff are very helpful, the location is indeed convenient for the Termini Station and the underground and buses, and the price is good, the breakfast at Mama Angelos is bog standard budget catering > square ham, plastic jam, orange squash, black water coffee, and the rooms are perfectly okay. We found the main drawback to be the noise from other guests, in part due to the very thin doors and noisy locks, and also as many guests seemed to be getting up early for coach tours, i.e. being awoken at 6am by next door Americans. Good for international student groups or other people that sleep like stones.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and clean”
Reviews.Author: jomish
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located with a short walk to Termini Central Station. The rooms are quite nice and clean. Our bathroom was newly refurbished. The hotel personnel spoke fluent English and was very helpful with all our questions. I would recommend as your 3-star stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very acceptable, and priced within competitors”
Reviews.Author: eichelman
Reviews.Content: This was a fine choice near the main train station. We couldnt walk much, so this was a great choice, central location. We couldn't find a cheaper hotel close by that looked safe. We felt safe. The elevator sometimes doesnt work because someone on another floor leaves a door open, but that is fixable. Our room was for 4, a full sized bed plus two pull down beds. Even with the beds down there was plenty of room. I see there was a large paint spot behind our door, but I never noticed it! The bath was good to. The breakfast wasnt worth the extra price, next time I would save the money and then choose my own restaurant. They gave us a fruit basket and there was a minifrig, nice!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel - Staff exceptional”
Reviews.Author: Hansen2273
Reviews.Content: I took my partner here for his birthday, i booked the hotel direct through there website after reading good reviews. Everything i requested i was given, i also mentioned it was a surprise for my boyfriend and on arrival we had a bottle of champagne, a fruit basket and a card which i thought was a great touch. The rooms are spacious and clean, and the bed was massive and really comfy. We had a tv, mini fridge and safety deposit box all at no extra cost. Breakfast was ok, just normal continental and served in the little restaurant next door. Hotel is really close to the Termini 5 mins walk max, so getting around Rome was really really easy. Staff were very helpful, i was feeling rough on the final day and are flight wasn't till 9 that nite, i think check out is 10.00am but they let us keep the room till 5.00pm that afternoon. I would highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for Rome”
Reviews.Author: LuckyLuk
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife and a couple of friends stayed in this hotel for 5 nights in january and we've been impressed by the dimenssions of the room (above average), the clean bathroom and the quiet area. To be mentioned that the price was 72 Euro per room per night, including breakfast. It's excelently located for visiting Rome, and I already recommended it to some of my friends who will go there. 3 minutes away from Termini Railroad, 20 minutes walking to Fontana di Trevi or any other central area. I also have been told that Best Western Globus hotel is a good choice, if you don't find available rooms at Romae. Mention: DO NOT go to the Outlet mall Castel Romano because it's not worth the approx 30km trip

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money, not bad”
Reviews.Author: MrWhyte
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night in Jan 07, worth it for the night, espcecially with the Winter Warmer Discount. Not the best 3 star, be good enough if you have a couple of nights in Rome and do not plan to spend anytime in your room apart from sleeping. Room very clean, bathroom with power shower, small tv. Smallest elevator I have ever been in, but not really important.. Very friendly and helpful staff let us keep our bags at hotel after we checked out

Reviews.Title: “quite the breakfast”
Reviews.Author: norah50
Reviews.Content: 2006 nov. Four blocks from the Termini. Street market one block away. Breakfast at a gorgeous bistro across the street and quite the buffet: yogurt, ham, rolls, cereal, juice, coffee, tea! Exceptional for a Roman breakfast. The hotel markets to the 20 something; but is a cordial fit for anyone who can do stairs. Fruit left in the room for new arrivals - a kind touch. Rooms are simple, dormlike. Good location for a Termini day trip schedule. American english speaking staff. The artwork on their web site is a good reflection of approach & attitude. Clean. The partnered Mama Angela food is less than average, but close, flexible & has a delightful extrovert running the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Ammenities”
Reviews.Author: Countrygalmd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in July 2006. We needed a place to stay and hadn't reserved a room. We ran across an American student in Florence who recommended this hotel. We paid 85 Euro a night. The hotel is five minute walking distance from Termini train station. It was very conveinant to catch the shuttle bus to Ciamprino airport from the train station. There is also another train stop that is only a few minutes away. I loved the free internet except it was sometimes a long wait to get on the computer. The staff wasn't very good at policing the free computer. The staff was extremely friendly. We had to go to the suites across the street from the main receptionist desk. One of the staffers walked us over so we could find the right building. The staff was very helpful in aswering questions and giving directions. I saw one of the staffers at the Billy Joel concert. I didn't recognize her when she said hello. She proceeded to remind me that she worked at the hotel. I think this hotel had the best amenities than any others we stayed at in Italy. The reception desk did exchanges, sold drinks and books on Rome. It also had a lift which was great after a long day of sightseeing or lifting up luggage. The reception area had beautiful paintings from a local artist. There was also a bar in the computer room. We also got 10% off on local restaurants on the same street. We only ate at the Bistro which had great food. They also served us breakfast in the morning. The breakfast selections were great. We had pastries, cereal, fruit and yogurt. The room was clean but the bathroom was a sore point. Our bathroom kept linking water. The line from the AC unit was not connected to the drain underneath of the system. They had it running to a cylinder which needed to be emptied. If not, it would run over into the floors. The bathroom decor was dated. It was nice to have a bathtub. I missed not having a bidet in the bathroom. The staff cleaned the rooms daily and changed towels daily. The air conditioning unit did not work. We had to open up the windows at night. We complained but nothing was really done about the AC. The morning sounds of the traffic and restaurants getting ready helped us to get up early. It was decent value for your money.
